headline.main: That Medical Test Costs $50, or Is It $500?

docs.abstract: In many ways our health care system is like an all-you-can-eat buffet. Someone else appears to be paying for it, so who cares how much it costs?
docs.snippet: In many ways our health care system is like an all-you-can-eat buffet. Someone else appears to be paying for it, so who cares how much it costs?

docs.lead_paragraph: One part of the Affordable Care Act is going according to plan, with U.S. states receiving and spending more money on the Medicaid health insurance program, a report released by the National Association of State Budget Officers on Thursday showed.

headline.main: U.S. States Get More, Spend More on Medicaid Under Obamacare: Report
headline.print_headline: U.S. States Get More, Spend More on Medicaid Under Obamacare: Report

docs.snippet: One part of the Affordable Care Act is going according to plan, with U.S. states receiving and spending more money on the Medicaid health insurance program, a report released by the National Association of State Budget Officers on Thursday showed.

docs.lead_paragraph: If American politicians are looking for a genuinely bipartisan issue to work together on, here’s a suggestion: invest in early education.
docs.abstract: Nicholas Kristof Op-Ed column urges lawmakers seeking bipartisan issue to push for major federal investment in early education, public policy that 71 percent of American voters say they would support; says real question is not whether United States can afford early education initiatives, but whether nation can afford not to provide them given studies showing their enormous economic and social benefits.
docs.snippet: If American politicians are looking for a genuinely bipartisan issue to work together on, here’s a suggestion: invest in early education.

docs.lead_paragraph: A device and app from Soundhawk, made to help people hear in certain settings, addresses problems that have hindered use of such devices in the past.

headline.main: Soundhawk Smart Listening System: A Hearing Helper
headline.print_headline: Hearing Gets an Assist from a Device That Puts the Listener in Control

docs.abstract: Gadgetwise column; Soundhawk is on mission to change the way consumers view hearing aids with the Smart Listening System, its first product; system consists of device and mobile application that help improve sounds in certain noisy environments.
docs.snippet: A device and app from Soundhawk, made to help people hear in certain settings, addresses problems that have hindered use of such devices in the past.

docs.lead_paragraph: New details about the broad reach of the president’s planned executive action on immigration emerged as he prepared to speak to the nation in a prime-time address on Thursday night.

headline.main: Obama’s Immigration Plan Could Shield Five Million
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Plan Could Shield Four Million

docs.snippet: New details about the broad reach of the president’s planned executive action on immigration emerged as he prepared to speak to the nation in a prime-time address on Thursday night.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ROBERT PEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court on Monday rejected Maine's effort to trim some young people from its Medicaid rolls, saying the move would violate the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: U.S. Court Rejects Maine's Effort to Trim Medicaid Rolls
headline.print_headline: U.S. Court Rejects Maine's Effort to Trim Medicaid Rolls

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court on Monday rejected Maine's effort to trim some young people from its Medicaid rolls, saying the move would violate the Affordable Care Act.

docs.lead_paragraph: An economist who said "the stupidity of the American voter" helped pass the complex federal health care law has agreed to finish his work on Vermont's health insurance systems for free, a top state official said Wednesday.

headline.main: 'Stupidity' Remark Leads to Free Health Site Work
headline.print_headline: 'Stupidity' Remark Leads to Free Health Site Work

docs.snippet: An economist who said "the stupidity of the American voter" helped pass the complex federal health care law has agreed to finish his work on Vermont's health insurance systems for free, a top state official said Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The most expensive congressional race in the nation ended Wednesday with no change: Democratic Rep. Ami Bera was re-elected to the Sacramento-area seat he wrested from Republican control just two years ago.
docs.snippet: The most expensive congressional race in the nation ended Wednesday with no change: Democratic Rep. Ami Bera was re-elected to the Sacramento-area seat he wrested from Republican control just two years ago.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. farmers are about to reap a bumper harvest not just in corn and soybeans but also in new subsidies that could soar to $10 billion, blowing a hole in the government's promise that its new five-year farm bill would save taxpayers money.

headline.main: U.S. Farmers Set to Get Huge Government Payouts Despite Bumper Harvest
headline.print_headline: U.S. Farmers Set to Get Huge Government Payouts Despite Bumper Harvest

docs.snippet: U.S. farmers are about to reap a bumper harvest not just in corn and soybeans but also in new subsidies that could soar to $10 billion, blowing a hole in the government's promise that its new five-year farm bill would save taxpayers money.

docs.lead_paragraph: Several employees of a south Florida company were arrested on Wednesday and accused of billing more than $25 million to Medicare and Medicaid on behalf of U.S. citizens living in Nicaragua and the Dominican Republic.

headline.main: Suspects Accused in Florida of Billing Medicare for Overseas Patients
headline.print_headline: Suspects Accused in Florida of Billing Medicare for Overseas Patients

docs.snippet: Several employees of a south Florida company were arrested on Wednesday and accused of billing more than $25 million to Medicare and Medicaid on behalf of U.S. citizens living in Nicaragua and the Dominican Republic.
